title: Change in potential difference for capacitor

content.question: A <math alttext="3.5 microfarad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>μ</mi><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> capacitor is connected to a <math alttext="12 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery and allowed to fully charge. The capacitor is then isolated from the battery, and a material with a dielectric constant of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted between the plates. Which of the following is the change in potential difference across the plates of the capacitor as the dielectric is inserted?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
